channel.title: South Korea Hunter Newswire
channel.description: Official dungeon, gate, and hunter news from South Korea and global events

item.title: Seoul Dungeon cleared by top-ranked solo hunter Lee Hyun; city traffic resumes normally.
Busan Guild signs renowned S-rank hunter Kim Ji-hoon for upcoming continental tournament.
Daegu underground gate collapses after high-level monster surge; no civilian casualties reported.
Global Hunter Rankings updated: South Korea dominates top five positions.
Incheon Night Market Dungeon experiences record loot drop; local vendors report surge in sales.
Jeju Island dungeon break prompts emergency hunter deployment; gates stabilized within three hours.
Seoul Martial Arts Tournament announces preliminary brackets for elite hunters.
Gangnam Guild merges with rival Goryeo Hunters to form new S-rank powerhouse.
National Dungeon Safety Board confirms zero casualties from newly opened Gwangju gate.
Ulsan solo hunter clears B-rank dungeon in record 42 minutes; footage goes viral.
Seoul Dungeon BOSS defeated by newly promoted A-rank hunter Park Min-jun.
International Guild Council reports South Korean hunters account for 37% of global gate activity.
Busan gate collapse triggers emergency alert; high-level hunter teams deployed immediately.
Jeju Dungeon Festival begins; top hunters expected to participate in exhibition matches.
Seoul hunter Lee Jae-hyun secures contract with international guild for global dungeon operations.
Gangnam city council approves expanded hunter zones after repeated gate surges.
Daejeon underground dungeon experiences sudden monster migration; no structural damage reported.
National rankings released: Kim So-ra overtakes Lee Hyun in solo clearance speed.
International gate activity spikes; South Korean hunters dispatched for cross-border operations.
Seoul Solo Hunter League announces upcoming elimination rounds.
Busan Guild signs new rookie talent from Daegu; expected to rise to B-rank within months.
Incheon gate breach neutralized by elite hunter team; civilian evacuation successful.
Daegu dungeon break video reaches 5 million views in less than 12 hours.
Jeju Island hunters deploy stabilizing wards after sudden mana fluctuations.
Global S-rank hunter summit scheduled in Seoul; participants from Japan, China, and USA confirmed.
Seoul Dungeon record: Lee Hyun clears 5 consecutive floors without using mana potions.
Gangnam Martial Arts Arena hosts open duel; 200 registered hunters participate.
Busan solo hunter ranks top in nationwide dungeon efficiency report.
Daejeon gate collapse contained by newly formed hunter strike force.
Incheon underground dungeon receives safety upgrades following minor monster breach.
Jeju Dungeon League standings released; Park Min-jun leads with fastest solo clear.
International Hunter Rankings update: South Korea maintains 12 of top 20 positions.
Seoul Dungeon BOSS respawn delayed; hunters advised to adjust training schedules.
Busan Huntersâ€™ Guild announces global exhibition match; live broadcast scheduled next month.
Gangnam hunter Kim Ji-hoon secures rare artifact in dungeon break; museum acquisition pending.
Daegu Dungeon record: fastest S-rank monster elimination achieved by rookie hunter.
Seoul Solo Hunter League adds new rating system for tracking dungeon efficiency.
National Dungeon Safety Board approves new hunter licensing requirements.
Incheon dungeon break footage used in global hunter training seminars.
Jeju Island gate instability reported; high-ranking hunters dispatched for inspection.
International dungeon monitoring agency commends South Korea for rapid breach response.
Busan martial tournament preliminaries conclude; semi-final matchups released.
Seoul hunter Park Min-jun signs multi-year contract with Goryeo Guild.
Gangnam underground dungeon receives hazard warnings; civilian access temporarily restricted.
Daegu Solo Hunter League updates scoring system; top hunters receive bonus rankings.
Jeju Dungeon Festival concludes; record participation reported for global hunters.
Incheon dungeon BOSS defeated in joint operation between two elite hunter teams.
National rankings published: Lee Hyun maintains top solo hunter status.
Busan Guild announces cross-border recruitment drive for S-rank talent.
Seoul Dungeon collapse narrowly avoided thanks to preemptive hunter strike.
